availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard James Jameson (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Givens in Harrison County, Kentucky, on November 4, 1847. Father of Mary A. Jameson, James K. Jameson, Elizabeth Jameson, Llwellyn Jameson, Samuel Jameson, and Maggie Jameson. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Killed by George Sidle in Harrison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 118A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 387.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 473.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896.
